name: St. Henry Walpole

locations.description: Jesuit priest martyred in London, England

summary: Henry Walpole was an English Jesuit priest and martyr who was executed during the reign of Elizabeth I. He was present at the execution of Edmund Campion, which inspired him to convert to Catholicism and enter the Jesuits. He was ordained in Spain and returned to England, where he was arrested almost immediately. He was tortured extensively and executed at York. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales.
